channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Scott Horton, Provoked
channel.desc: Book TV interviews authors at FreedomFest, an annual libertarian conference held in 2025 in Palm Springs, Calif.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Brooke Barbier, King Hancock
channel.desc: Author Brooke Barbier discusses the life and leadership of Founding Father John Hancock.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: James Fichter, Tea: Consumption, Politics, and Revolution, 1773-1776
channel.desc: Author James Fichter talks about the role and politics of tea leading up to the American Revolution.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lev Dobriansky, Unyielding Resolve
channel.desc: Former diplomat Paula Dobriansky and others discuss her late father Lev Dobriansky's posthumously published book about the resistance to Russian imperialism from the days of the U.S.S.R. to the present day.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Chile Eboe-Osuji, End of Immunity
channel.desc: Former President of the International Criminal Court, Chile Eboe-Osuji, explores the history of international criminal law and offers suggestions for holding war criminals accountable in the future.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Paul Rice, Every Purchase Matters - How Fair Trade Farmers, Companies, and Consumers are Changing the World
channel.desc: Paul Rice, founder of Fair Trade USA, examines the history of the fair trade movement and argues for "conscious capitalism"; the Commonwealth Club of California hosted this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Patrick McGee, Apple in China
channel.desc: Financial Times San Francisco Correspondent Patrick McGee examines Apple's relationship with China and the impact of locating so many factories there; the Commonwealth Club of California in San Francisco hosts this event.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Joseph Torigian, The Party's Interests Come First
channel.desc: This biography of Chinese President Xi Jinping's father, Xi Zhongxun - a leading figure in the Chinese Communist Party - is said to inform our understanding of the son.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: FreedomFest 2025 - Naomi Brockwell, Beginner's Introduction to Privacy

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Texas Woman's University history professor Cecily Zander discusses the federal government's efforts to explore and control the American West from the early 1800s through the Civil War.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This Works Progress Administration film shows projects in New York including reservoir construction, improvement of parks and training technicians.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Presidency
channel.desc: Daniel Feller, Andrew Jackson Papers editor emeritus, looks back at 1834 and the consequential events that year in Jackson's presidency.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This film profiles the varied war experiences of returning World War II service members and anticipates how they will apply new skills to jobs at home.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Give Me Liberty or Give Me Death Speech - 250th Anniversary
channel.desc: On the 250th anniversary of Patrick Henry's famous speech, the VA250 Commission commemorates the event with actors portraying delegates and remarks from Virginia Governor Glenn Youngkin (R) and filmmaker Ken Burns.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lectures in History
channel.desc: Indiana University history professor Juan Mora discusses the U.S. Border Patrol and how 20th century immigration laws shaped the creation and development of immigration agencies.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Matthew Restall, The Nine Lives of Christopher Columbus
channel.desc: Why is it that Christopher Columbus is prompting political controversy in the United States more than 500 years after his 1506 death? The U.S. Capitol Historical Society hosts Matthew Restall, a Columbus scholar, to provide answers.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: The Civil War
channel.desc: A look at the people and events that shaped the American Civil War and Reconstruction.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: How the Supreme Court Changed Over Time
channel.desc: The Supreme Court Historical Society hosts a lecture in the court's Washington, D.C., chamber to consider how the nation's highest court has evolved since the time of the Founders.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: President John Adams Family Memorial
channel.desc: Congress created the Adams Memorial Foundation in 2001 to honor President John Adams, his wife Abigail and their son John Quincy Adams - the nation's sixth president; this event is to build support for a memorial in Washington, D.C.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Lessons of the Past
channel.desc: Scholars hold a conversation based on the premise that policymakers often use history badly; how can this be rectified, so that historical analogies offer more thoughtful solutions for the present?

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: This film profiles the varied war experiences of returning World War II service members and anticipates how they will apply new skills to jobs at home.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Give Me Liberty or Give Me Death Speech - 250th Anniversary
channel.desc: On the 250th anniversary of Patrick Henry's famous speech, the VA250 Commission commemorates the event with actors portraying delegates and remarks from Virginia Governor Glenn Youngkin (R) and filmmaker Ken Burns.

channel.name: CSPAN 3 US
channel.title: Reel America
channel.desc: An Academy Award-nominated short documentary takes viewers on a tour through the Library's reading rooms and operations, highlighting how the institution benefits the public and scholars worldwide.
